description: These projects gave me a lot of solid, hands-on development experience, and they’re some of the most polished and complete ones I’ve worked on. I’ve put my other half-finished or outdated little side projects over [here](https://github.com/TypingHare/archives).

entries.name: [JytSmart](https://github.com/TypingHare/jytsmart)
entries.description: My very first project in my coding career. It is the backend of an WeChat mini program from a startup project. It allows organizers to announce in-person events, and allows users to book them.

entries.name: [Wildtrace Farm](https://github.com/TypingHare/archives/tree/main/wildtrace-farm)
entries.description: My capstone project from the OOPL course, and the first game I ever created. It is a pixel-style game inspired by Stardew Valley.

entries.name: [Board Game Clock](https://github.com/TypingHare/TypingHare/tree/main)
entries.description: A responsive touchscreen clock application for board games like Chess and Go.

entries.name: [Node Gallery](https://github.com/TypingHare/node-gallery)
entries.description: A gallery project for a friend's personal website. I refactored the codebase using TypeScript and Koa, and implemented a hash-based caching system along with automatic asset-scanning features.

entries.name: [stack-queue](https://github.com/TypingHare/stack-queue)
entries.description: A lightweight TypeScript library implements stack and queue data structures.

entries.name: [Mazemouse](https://github.com/TypingHare/archives/tree/main/mazemouse)
entries.description: A C++ program for an MIT Micromouse competition. It implements maze-solving logic and simulator for navigating mazes. I was responsible for algorithms and the simulator.

entries.name: [Hare Forms](https://github.com/TypingHare/hare-forms)
entries.description: My personal website. Hares build forms instead of digging burrows like rabbits.

entries.name: [Trick](https://github.com/TypingHare/trick)
entries.description: A CLI tool for encrypting and decrypting credential files so you can safely store them in remote repositories.

entries.name: [Burrow](https://github.com/TypingHare/burrow)
entries.description: A Kotlin-based CLI tool that provides customizable, modular environment aimed at streamlining command-line workflows. **I am now refactoring it using Go**.

entries.name: [hare-conf.nvim](https://github.com/TypingHare/hare-conf.nvim)
entries.description: A Neovim plugin for managing configuration centrally.

entries.name: [Course Sync](https://github.com/TypingHare/course-sync)
entries.description: A CLI tool that helps students and teachers synchronize course materials using Git, without requiring a central server.
